body:
Yep, I've seen the warnings popping up.
The workaround I'd like to propose is the following: we create a `python_header.h` (suggestions for naming are welcome) in `torch/csrc/utils` containing
```
#pragma once

#undef _POSIX_C_SOURCE
#undef _POSIX_THREADS
#undef _XOPEN_SOURCE

#include <Python.h>
```
and include that file instead of including `Python.h` directly throughout the codebase. This should allow us to remove all `#include <Python.h>` where it's not needed.

This has been done in other projects, e.g. https://github.com/Slicer/VTK/blob/58e382c061ec870de18ef1516db3009c30ae6577/Wrapping/Python/vtkPython.h

#include <Python.h>

and include that file instead of including Python.h directly throughout the codebase. This should allow us to remove all #include <Python.h> where it's not needed.
This has been done in other projects, e.g. https://github.com/Slicer/VTK/blob/58e382c061ec870de18ef1516db3009c30ae6577/Wrapping/Python/vtkPython.h
